#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Brazil defeats China in 5-a-side football in group play at London Paralympics
#Text=Wednesday , September 5 , 2012
#Text=Brazil warms upImage : Laura Hale .
#Text=China warms upImage : Laura Hale .
#Text=London , England — Yesterday at London 's Riverbank Arena , Brazil 's 5-a-side blind football team took on China in both teams ' final game of group play .
#Text=Brazil won 1 – 0 , topping Group B.
#Text=Both teams came into the game with similar records .
#Text=Each had one win and a draw , and were tied on goal difference .
#Text=A win would see them through to the finals .
#Text=In case of a draw , the two sides would be reduced to drawing lots .
#Text=Brazil won gold in 5-a-side football at both past Paralympic Games where it was included — Athens in 2004 , and Beijing in 2008 where they defeated China 2 – 1 in the final .
#Text=China won silver in Beijing even though they had no national team prior to hosting the Games there .
#Text=There were about 150 people in the crowd at the Riverbank Arena when the game began , although this swelled to over 500 after half time .
#Text=The weather was sunny and warm .
#Text=There were a number of flags on display in the crowd , including the flags of Brazil , Turkey and France , and the ubiquitous Union Flag .
#Text=The two teams had different rituals when their national anthems were played .
#Text=The Brazilians had their hands over their hearts , whereas the Chinese stood at attention and sang while theirs was played .
#Text=Most startlingly , they threw their hands up in the air and shouted at the end .
#Text=Five-a-side football players wear blindfolds to insure a level playing field , as some blind people are more blind than others .
#Text=However , the goalkeepers are sighted , and , like the goalkeepers in regular football , can use their hands .
#Text=When ball is in play , spectators are asked to be keep silent so the players can hear the ball , which has bells in it .
#Text=It was quite loud , and audible from the bleachers .
#Text=It is also heavier than a regular football .
#Text=There are three guides for each team who tell players where the ball is .
#Text=The blue artificial surface — the same used for the hockey during the Olympics — could be slippery at times .
#Text=Occasionally the players would run into each other or the goal post .
#Text=At one point , the Brazilian goalkeeper stopped the ball with his crotch , which caused his to fall to the ground writing in pain .
#Text=The umpire cautioned him at one point but never produced any coloured cards .
#Text=The playing field is smaller than a regular football pitch , and the goal is small .
#Text=The pitch has walls on the sides that help to rebound the sound and the ball itself .
#Text=Bouncing the ball of the side is a standard tactic .
#Text=The rules are fairly similar to eleven-a-side football .
#Text=The game consists of two 25 minute halves with a 10 minute break between halves .
#Text=There is no off-side rule .
#Text=Both sides played defensively , with three players back and one forward , so there was little passing but a lot of foot skill .
#Text=In earlier games they played with two forward and two back .
#Text=As a rule , the Brazilians favoured a more open style of play .
#Text=The game was fairly even early on .
#Text=Brazil had a couple of good shots at goal that the Chinese goal keeper was lucky to stop .
#Text=China 's Wang Zhoubin also had a shot at goal that bounced off the goal post with a resounding noise .
#Text=About 21 minutes in , Brazil 's Jeferson da Conceicai Goncalves scored the first goal .
#Text=His teammates jumped all over field , and guides walked the players to the team celebration .
#Text=After half time , the defensive game continued , although Brazil started sending another player forward .
#Text=Chinese attacks tended to still be from a single player .
#Text=Shortly after halftime , a mix up saw two Brazilian defenders compete for the ball , and they nearly scored an own goal .
#Text=Wang then made a spectacular shot which missed the goal .
#Text=As the second half wore on , China switched to a two-forward formation .
#Text=Li Xiaoqiang and Wang pressed a series of attacks , which garnered a lot of ooohs from the crowd but nothing on the scoreboard .
#Text=Meanwhile , Brazil continued aggressively , with Marcos Jose Alves Felipe in particular looking threatening .
#Text=The Brazilian contingent in the crowd roared loudly at the final siren .
#Text=Asked how he felt to have made the semifinals , Brazil Coach Ramon Pereira de Souza said : " I have no words .
